monster.translation[0].definitions[0].de: an imaginary or ancient creature that is large, ugly, and frightening
monster.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the remains of a prehistoric monster
the search for the Loch Ness Monster
monster.translation[0].definitions[1].de: someone who is very cruel and evil
monster.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Only a monster could kill all those women.
monster.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a small child, especially one who is behaving badly – used humorously
monster.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: I’ve got to get home and feed this little monster.
monster.translation[0].definitions[3].de: an object, animal etc that is unusually large
monster.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Did you see the fish Dad caught? It was a monster!
There’s a monster of a spider in the bath!
monster.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a dangerous or threatening problem, especially one that develops gradually and is difficult to manage
monster.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The song was a monster hit.
